reviews.title: Crap.... do not bother going here
reviews.text: This hotel was a last minute stop for us on our trip. The outside looked fine. The lobby was charming but what happened after that will remain with me for some time.

reviews.title: AS Close to being in Jail as it gets
reviews.text: The smell in the rest of the hotel was just.... nasty. The room was pokey and not very nice. The hotel had a restaurant and bar, neither of which were open. Room service was not available either. Vending options were limited.

reviews.title: OH MY GOD
reviews.text: Then.... time for sleep. Or lack of it. The noises in this hotel were horrendous. We hardly slept at all and could not wait to check out, and there was no breakfast.

reviews.title: Did not live up to my expectations.
reviews.text: I would not suggest staying here at all. It is overpriced and over rated.

reviews.title: Charming Hotel
reviews.text: Attended a conference here with advance reservations for a room with a balcony. Several hours after check-in time, I was given a room next to the ice machine and service elevator with no balcony. I can understand that various factors influence room assignments, and was willing to overlook that aspect of it, but the rooms are microscopically small, mattresses thin, lumpy and lopsided.

reviews.title: hotel natchez eola
reviews.text: Recently stayed at the natchez eola supposedly the best hotel in town but way overpriced at 100.00 pernight tax incld for a room with no view. Their checkout time of 11am is stricly enforced even with empty rooms they would not allow me a senior citizen to remain in my room for 2 additional hours something most hotels of this type gladly grant. I made a big mistake staying there dining room is overpriced and no continental breakfast is included in rate.My advice to anyone visiting natchez is stay at the casino hotel down the hill for half the price and they provide free jitney service to town and the bus terminal

reviews.title: Great lobby and restaurant, room average
reviews.text: We stayed at the Natchez Eola in June 2003 (room 213). The lobby and restaurant are amazing. The room on the other hand was VERY average (reminded me of any regular motel room). Basically, you're paying for the ambience (which is limited to the lobby/restaurant), so you might as well pay a little more and get a room at a plantation to have that same ambience in the room you're staying in as well, and not restricted to the downstairs area. My two complaints would be that the sink fawcett in our room was completely loose (it had come out of its fitting) and that I called the reception numerous times to have our phone line connected, but the line was constantly busy (for over two hours....). I don't think I would stay here again, simply because it's not really worth the amount we paid (I'd rather pay a little more and stay at a plantation). Nonetheless, it was clean and generally ok.

reviews.title: Great Hotel for the price
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Eola for 3 nights. Trust me when I say that when you reserve a room, write down not only the confirmation number but the person you spoke with and the date and time. The hotel "lost" our reservation even though my boyfriend called that very morning to confirm our room! Anyway, after alot of back and forth with the front desk, our reservation was finally found (not surprisingly). The hotel was almost full as there were 2 weddings that weekend so the manager pulled some strings (if you want to call it that) and got us a room with a view of the Mississippi (what we originally requested when we booked the room 2 weeks prior). The room itself was nice, kind of small, but had a nice 4 poster king bed, a skylight, and the baloncey had a beautiful view of the River. So, despite the front desk mix-up, I was pleased with what we got. The staff was nice and courteous and the restaurant-I think it was called The Julep-had decent food. Be aware that the breakfast buffet closes precisely at 10 am-it wont tell you that on the menu.

reviews.title: loved the atmosphere and charm
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel with olde worlde charm that will be difficult to emulate in many towns or cities in the Deep South. Starting with a welcome drink and a stunning lobby this hotel modestly understates its unique and stately past history. Bedrooms smaller than average but nothing to complain about. Definately recommended and the buffet style breakfasts and lunches are very good value.
